intro: Pimpinella pilosa, commonly known as hairy cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Pimpinella pilosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
